title: Jessica Chastain goes make-up free while bundling up during solo outing in New York City
text:
Her latest flick, IT: Chapter Two was released last month to mixed reviews.

But Jessica Chastain proved nothing was going to bring her down on Sunday, spotted wearing a large smile on her face while out in New York City.

The 42-year-old was makeup free and appeared in high spirits while enjoying a solo outing.

Natural: Jessica Chastain went makeup free on Sunday for a solo outing in New York City

Jessica rocked a velvet green button-up shirt and pants combo for the outing.

Over the top the actress threw on a camel colored overcoat for some added warmth for the late afternoon stroll.

She completed her look with a pair of burgundy colored boots for complete comfort.

Stylish: Jessica rocked a velvet green button-up shirt and pants combo for the outing

Casual look: Jessica's auburn tresses were styled out naturally with its short length grazing her shoulders

Jessica's auburn tresses were styled out naturally with its short length grazing her shoulders.

The Molly's Game star showcased her enviable makeup free complexion while out and about.

Last week Jessica spoke out in praise of IT co-star James McAvoy on his stance on equal pay.

Gorgeous: The Molly's Game star showcased her enviable makeup free complexion while out and about

'I'm going to say something nice about James McAvoy here. Before the #MeToo movement, before Time's Up, before anything like that, James was always a proponent of equal pay,' she told OK! Magazine.

'Even when we did The Disappearance of Eleanor Rigby [in 2013], he and I were doing the same amount of work, the same everything, and we got equal pay for that movie.

'He's always been a proponent of that. He's posted about it on his Instagram before it was the cool thing to do,' she said.

'He's an incredible human being.'
description: Jessica Chastain went makeup free on Sunday for a solo outing in New York City. The 42-year-old appeared in high spirits and rugged up with a warm coat.
